SEARCH
Package com.example.chicksevent.misc

Class Admin

java.lang.Object
com.example.chicksevent.misc.User
com.example.chicksevent.misc.Admin
public class Admin extends User
Represents an administrator user with elevated permissions within the ChicksEvent app.

Responsibilities include browsing and administratively deleting events, organizers, and entrants. All read/write operations are executed against Firebase Realtime Database via FirebaseService and use the Play Services Task API for asynchronous completion.

Key user stories

  • US 03.01.01 — Admin can delete an event.
  • US 03.05.01 — Admin can browse events.

Threading / async: All public methods that touch Firebase return a Task which completes on the listener thread provided by the Google Tasks framework.

  • Constructor Details

    • Admin

      public Admin(String userId)
      Constructs an Admin for the given user ID.
      Parameters:
      userId - the unique identifier of this admin user (must not be null).
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if userId is null

  • Method Details

    • deleteEvent

      public void deleteEvent(String eventId)
      Deletes an event from the database by its ID. (US 03.01.01)

      This issues a single remove operation to /Event/{eventId}. If the eventId is null or empty, the operation is a no-op (logged but not failed). If Firebase returns an error, it will be observable via the returned task's failure listener.

      Parameters:
      eventId - the Firebase key of the event to delete; must be non-empty.

    • deletePoster

      public void deletePoster(String eventId)
      Deletes a poster from the database by its ID.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the Firebase key of the event poster to delete; must be non-empty.

    • browseUsers

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<List<User>> browseUsers()
      Retrieves all entrant profiles from the database.

      Reads the entire /User node, creates a User instance for each child using the Firebase key as the user ID. Returns a list of lightweight User objects.

      Returns:
      a Task that resolves to a List of User objects on success.

    • browseOrganizers

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<List<Organizer>> browseOrganizers()
      Retrieves all organizer profiles from the database.

      Reads the entire /Organizer node, deserializes each child into an Organizer object, and assigns the Firebase key as the organizer ID.

      Returns:
      a Task that resolves to a List of Organizer objects on success.

    • browseProfile

      public void browseProfile()
      Browses (reads) the admin's profile.

      Status: Not yet implemented. Reserved for future use when admin profile schema is defined.

    • browseEvents

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<List<Event>> browseEvents()
      Retrieves all events from the database. (US 03.05.01)

      Performs a one-shot read of the /Event root. Each child is expected to be a map of string fields. Currently constructs Event objects using hardcoded parameter order based on expected fields from the map (temporary until proper POJO mapping is implemented).

      Returns:
      a Task that resolves to a list of Event objects on success.

    • deleteOrganizerProfile

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> deleteOrganizerProfile(String organizerId)
      Deletes an organizer's profile from the database.

      Removes the entire node at /Organizer/{organizerId}. If the ID is null or empty, the task fails immediately with an IllegalArgumentException.

      Parameters:
      organizerId - the Firebase key of the organizer to delete
      Returns:
      a Task that completes with null on success or an exception on failure
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if organizerId is null or empty

    • deleteUserProfile

      public void deleteUserProfile(String entrantId)
      Deletes an entrant's profile from the database.

      Issues a delete operation at /User/{entrantId}. No-op if ID is null or empty.

      Parameters:
      entrantId - the Firebase key of the entrant to delete

    • isOrganizer

      public Boolean isOrganizer()
      Identifies whether this user is an organizer.
      Overrides:
      isOrganizer in class User
      Returns:
      always false for Admin instances

    • getEventsByOrganizer

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<List<String>> getEventsByOrganizer(String organizerId)
      Retrieves all events created by a specific organizer.
      Parameters:
      organizerId - the user ID of the organizer
      Returns:
      a Task that resolves to a list of Event IDs created by the organizer

    • deleteEventAndCleanup

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> deleteEventAndCleanup(String eventId, String eventName)
      Deletes an event and cleans up all related data (WaitingList, Notifications). Also notifies all entrants that the event has been cancelled.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the ID of the event to delete
      eventName - the name of the event (for notification message)
      Returns:
      a Task that completes when the deletion and cleanup are done

    • isEventHappeningToday

      private boolean isEventHappeningToday(String eventStartDate)
      Checks if an event is happening today based on its eventStartDate.
      Parameters:
      eventStartDate - the event start date in YYYY-MM-DD format (can be null or empty)
      Returns:
      true if the event is happening today, false otherwise

    • isEventInPast

      private boolean isEventInPast(String eventStartDate)
      Checks if an event has already happened (eventStartDate is before today).
      Parameters:
      eventStartDate - the event start date in YYYY-MM-DD format (can be null or empty)
      Returns:
      true if the event has already happened, false otherwise

    • banUserFromOrganizer

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> banUserFromOrganizer(String userId, String reason)
      Bans a user from creating new events as an organizer. Puts all events created by the user on hold (except events happening today or events that have already happened) and notifies them of the ban.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user to ban
      reason - the reason for banning the organizer
      Returns:
      a Task that completes when the ban is processed

    • unbanUserFromOrganizer

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> unbanUserFromOrganizer(String userId)
      Unbans a user, allowing them to create events again. Takes all their events off hold and notifies them and all entrants.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user to unban
      Returns:
      a Task that completes when the unban is processed
